speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: SCENE VIII. A field of battle.

speaker: LARTIUS
text_entry: Alarum as in battle. Enter, from opposite sides, MARCIUS and AUFIDIUS

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: I'll fight with none but thee; for I do hate thee

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Worse than a promise-breaker.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: We hate alike:

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Not Afric owns a serpent I abhor

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: More than thy fame and envy. Fix thy foot.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Let the first budger die the other's slave,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And the gods doom him after!

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: If I fly, Marcius,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Holloa me like a hare.

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Within these three hours, Tullus,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Alone I fought in your Corioli walls,

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: And made what work I pleased: 'tis not my blood

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Wherein thou seest me mask'd; for thy revenge

speaker: MARCIUS
text_entry: Wrench up thy power to the highest.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Wert thou the Hector

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: That was the whip of your bragg'd progeny,

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Thou shouldst not scape me here.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: They fight, and certain Volsces come to the aid of  AUFIDIUS. MARCIUS fights till they be driven in breathless

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Officious, and not valiant, you have shamed me

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: In your condemned seconds.

speaker: AUFIDIUS
text_entry: Exeunt
